meanings.definition: Required to be paid or done at a certain time.
meanings.sent1: The dued amount must be paid by Friday.
meanings.sent2: The bill is dued by the end of the month.
meanings.sent3: The dued deadline loomed closer and closer.
meanings.sent4: Her dued assignment weighed heavily on her mind.
meanings.sent5: The dued date was circled in red on the calendar.

meanings.sent1: The dued money must be repaid soon.
meanings.sent2: The loan is dued to the bank.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly referred to his dued lunch as a debt to his stomach.
meanings.sent4: The dued favor hung over him like a dark cloud.
meanings.sent5: The dued amount grew larger with each passing day.

meanings.sent1: The dued package is scheduled for delivery tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: The event is dued to start in an hour.
meanings.sent3: The dued surprise party was a challenge to keep secret.
meanings.sent5: The dued announcement created a buzz of anticipation.
